channel.title: Frederick Boehm's Website
channel.description: Recent content on Frederick Boehm's Website

item.title: Deciphering GEMMA’s C++ Code
item.description: My goal is to translate the C++ code in GEMMA/src/mvlmm.cpp to mathematical notation and, ultimately, to R code. Zhou’s C++ code uses the gsl C++ library. CalcXHiY C++ code Let’s examine the function CalcXHiY which runs from line 357-384 of mvlmm.cpp. I reproduce them here: void CalcXHiY(const gsl_vector *eval, const gsl_vector *D_l, const gsl_matrix *X, const gsl_matrix *UltVehiY, gsl_vector *xHiy) { size_t n_size=eval->size, c_size=X->size1, d_size=D_l->size; gsl_vector_set_zero (xHiy); double x, delta, dl, y, d; for (size_t i=0; i<d_size; i++) { dl=gsl_vector_get(D_l, i); for (size_t j=0; j<c_size; j++) { d=0.

item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.description: EDUCATION Ph.D. in Statistics, University of Wisconsin-Madison, 2018 (anticipated) M.D., University of Wisconsin-Madison, 2007 M.S. in Population Health Sciences, University of Wisconsin-Madison, 2007 B.S. in Chemistry, Mathematics, and Biochemistry, University of Wisconsin-Madison, 2001 EMPLOYMENT University of Wisconsin-Madison Molecular and Environmental Toxicology Center, Postdoctoral Trainee, 2012-2014 University of Wisconsin-Madison Value-Added Research Center, Assistant Researcher, 2011 University of Washington Department of Biostatistics, Senior Fellow, 2007-2009 AWARDS & HONORS IRES Research Ethics Fellowship, University of Wisconsin-Madison, 2013-2014

item.title: A ‘page’ type for blogdown & hugo lithium theme
item.description: I didn’t like the fact that my ‘About’ and ‘Research’ pages included a Disqus section, as I don’t need comments on these materials. I decided to find a way to create pages - which are not blog posts - that don’t have the Disqus section. I’m using, as of right now, Yihui Xie’s hugo lithium theme, with a few small modifications that I’ve documented in my first blog post. The Hugo documentation on types is quite good.

item.title: GEMMA's EM algorithm implemented in R
item.description: I need to estimate variance components for a linear mixed effects model. Specifically, I need to consider the model, from Zhou and Stephens (2014): \[Y = BX + G + E\] where \(Y\) is a \(2\) by \(n\) matrix of (possibly correlated) phenotypes (for \(n\) subjects), \(B\) is a \(2\) by \(c\) matrix of allelic effect sizes (where \(c\) denotes the number of alleles per locus), \(X\) is a \(c\) by \(n\) matrix containing genotypes (or genotype probabilities), \(G\) is a \(2\) by \(n\) matrix of random effects and \(E\) is a \(2\) by \(n\) matrix of random errors, which are assumed to be independent of \(G\).

item.title: About
item.description: Frederick Boehm is a biostatistics researcher and teacher who lives in Madison, Wisconsin.

item.title: Getting started with blogdown
item.description: While browsing the internet, I stumbled upon Rstudio’s new package blogdown. I read posts from Karl Broman and found the the book that the package authors - Yihui Xie and Amber Thomas - freely share. One tricky part of setting up the website involved the DNS settings. I bought the site fboehm.us through google domains. While the blogdown book provides instructions for DNS settings for other domain name providers, at the time I set up my site, they hadn’t written instructions for use with google domains.
